meanings.definition: Feelings of anxiety or dismay, typically at something unexpected.
meanings.sent1: The sudden news of the test results filled her with consternations.
meanings.sent2: His consternations were evident when he realized he had lost his wallet.
meanings.sent3: The cat's consternations at seeing a cucumber behind it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds approaching brought consternations to the villagers, fearing a storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's consternations about the upcoming parent-teacher meeting kept her up at night.

meanings.sent1: The soldier's face showed deep consternations as he saw the enemy approaching.
meanings.sent2: The team was in consternations after losing the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The consternations on the child's face when he dropped his ice cream were priceless.
meanings.sent4: The silence that followed his announcement filled the room with consternations.
meanings.sent5: The actor's consternations before going on stage were visible in his trembling hands.
